alert.note: Alert for Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 9:22PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Washoe and northwestern Pershing Counties through 1030 PM PDT... At 920 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles north of Pyramid Lake to 13 miles east of Gerlach-Empire to 25 miles northwest of Lovelock. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Areas of blowing dust may reduce visibility. Locations impacted include... Gerlach, Gerlach-Empire, Old Razorback Mountain, Seven Troughs Mountain, Empire, Dry Mountain, Fox Mountain, Sand Pass, Smoke Creek Desert, Empire Airport, Kumiva Peak, Granite Peak, Rosebud Peak, and Black Rock City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
